subject: Re: [junit] mock object for classes
msgSnippet: i need some methods like createControl in easymock. i dont want to create another class for mocking. i have read following link thnx for that. ... [Non-text
messageBody:
i need some methods like createControl in easymock.
i dont want to create another class for mocking.
i have read following link
thnx for that.


On 1/28/08, David Peterson <david@...> wrote:
>
> EasyMock has an extension library for mocking concrete classes. And
> JMock
> has a ClassImposteriser extension. See:
> http://www.jmock.org/mocking-classes.html
>
> However, you might also want to read:
>
> http://www.mockobjects.com/2007/04/test-smell-mocking-concrete-classes.html
>
> David
> ---
> David Peterson
> http://blog.davidpeterson.co.uk
> http://www.concordion.org
>
> On 28/01/2008, PankajKHARE <pankaj.0405@...<pankaj.0405%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> >
> >
> > easymock is specially used for inteface.
> > any other mock object for classes ?
> > --
> > View this message in context:
> > http://www.nabble.com/mock-object-for-classes-tp15131982p15131982.html
> > Sent from the JUnit - User mailing list archive at Nabble.com<http://nabble.com/>
> .
> >
> >
> >
>

>
